case_vignette: A 25-year-old man presents to the emergency department after a motor vehicle accident. He was the unrestrained front seat driver in a head on collision. The patient is unresponsive and his medical history is unknown. His temperature is 99.5°F (37.5°C), blood pressure is 67/38 mmHg, pulse is 190/min, respirations are 33/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. The patient is started on IV fluids, blood products, and norepinephrine. A FAST exam is performed and a pelvic binder is placed. One hour later, his temperature is 98.3°F (36.8°C), blood pressure is 119/66 mmHg, pulse is 110/min, respirations are 15/min, and oxygen saturation is 97% on room air. The patient is currently responsive. Management of the patient's pelvic fracture is scheduled by the orthopedic service. While the patient is waiting in the emergency department he suddenly complains of feeling hot, aches, and a headache. The patient's temperature is currently 101°F (38.3°C). He has not been given any pain medications and his past medical history is still unknown.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm feeling hot, achy, and I have a headache.
Have you had any fever or chills?
Yes, I'm feeling hot and my temperature is currently 101°F.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to someone who has been sick?
My medical history is unknown, so I can't say for sure about recent travel or exposure.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
I can't provide that information right now; my medical history is unknown.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels?
I don't have that information; my medical history is still unknown.
Have you had any recent changes in your skin or mucous membranes?
I'm sorry, but I don't have any information about that.
Have you had any recent changes in your breathing or coughing?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my breathing or coughing.
Have you had any recent changes in your vision or hearing?
I haven't provided any information about changes in my vision or hearing.
Have you had any recent changes in your digestion or urination?
I haven't reported any changes in my digestion or urination.
Have you had any recent changes in your mood or behavior?
There's no information about any changes in my mood or behavior.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history of illnesses?
My medical history, including family history, is unknown.
Final Diagnosis: Influenza.
